word_mean: 缓冲系：化学缓冲系，指一种化学体系，可防止另一化学物质的浓度改变，例如质子供体和受体系统用于防止氢离子浓度(pH)明显改变
物理或生理缓冲系，指帮助保持稳态的物理和生理体系，如调节血压的反射
保持加、卸试验力平稳，或减缓试样断裂时冲击的装置。

sentence.Network_en: Keep savings as a buffer against unexpected cash needs.
sentence.Network_cn: 存些积蓄以备不时之需。

sentence.Network_en: Turkey and Greece were buffer states against the former Soviet Union.
sentence.Network_cn: 土耳其和希腊是前苏联与反苏国家之间的缓冲国。

sentence.Network_en: Support from family and friends acts as a buffer against stress.
sentence.Network_cn: 家庭和朋友的支持有助于减缓压力。

derivation.yuyuan_name: mid 19th cent.: probably from obsolete buff (verb), imitative of the sound of a blow to a soft body
mid 18th cent.: probably from obsolete buff (see buffer), or from dialect buff 'stutter, splutter' (possibly the same word). In late Middle English  buffer had the sense 'stammerer'

entry.def: A buffer is something that prevents something else from being harmed or that prevents two things from harming each other.

example.ex: Keep savings as a buffer against unexpected cash needs...
example.tran: 存些积蓄以备不时之需。

example.ex: ...a multinational buffer force between the two sides...
example.tran: 双方之间的多国缓冲力量

entry.def: If something is buffered, it is protected from harm.

example.ex: The company is buffered by long-term contracts with growers.
example.tran: 公司通过与种植户签订长期合同得到保障。

entry.tran: （火车上的）缓冲器；（火车轨道末端的）防撞栅
entry.def: The buffers on a train or at the end of a railway line are two metal discs on springs that reduce the shock when a train hits them.
A buffer is an area in a computer's  memory where information can be stored for a short time.
If you say that someone, usually a man, is an old buffer, you mean that you think they are rather foolish.

example.ex: ...a collection of old buffers who meet at the Grosvenor House once a month for lunch.
example.tran: 每月一次在格罗夫纳大厦进行午餐聚会的一群蠢老头们

means.word_mean: 1. an ionic compound that resists changes in its pH
2. an inclined metal frame at the front of a locomotive to clear the track

3. (computer science) a part of RAM used for temporary storage of data that is waiting to be sent to a device; used to compensate for differences in the rate of flow of data between components of a computer system
4. a power tool used to buff surfaces
5. a cushion-like device that reduces shock due to contact
6. an implement consisting of soft material mounted on a block; used for polishing (as in manicuring)

auth_sentence.content: This buffer against volatility continued even six months later.
auth_sentence.res_content: This buffer against volatility continued even six months later.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: This buffer against volatility continued even six months later.

auth_sentence.content: So he added lithium salt to buffer the manic acid.
auth_sentence.res_content: So he added lithium salt to buffer the manic acid.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: So he added lithium salt to buffer the manic acid.

auth_sentence.content: There will be no buffer between them and the coast.
auth_sentence.res_content: There will be no buffer between them and the coast.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: There will be no buffer between them and the coast.

Sentence.sentence: The government also established a stockpile (贮存) of oil as a short-term buffer (缓冲) against future shortages.

sentences.en: A little money can be a useful buffer in time of need.
sentences.cn: 在急需时, 很少一点钱就能解燃眉之急。

sentences.en: Romantic love will buffer you against life's hardships.
sentences.cn: 浪漫的爱会减轻生活的艰辛。

jushi.english: A little money can be a useful buffer in time of need.
jushi.chinese: 在急需时，很少一点钱就能解燃眉之急。

jushi.english: Buffers absorbed most of the shock.
jushi.chinese: 缓冲器使振动减少了许多。

jushi.english: Friends are excellent buffers in times of crisis.
jushi.chinese: 朋友是最好的缓解危机的人。
